item.description:
This is a Czech film from 1999 which won a number of European film festival awards for director, screenplay and acting.

Described as a "whimsical comedy of errors", this movie transplants the main character from Dostoyevsky's "The Idiot" into modern times. I'm intrigued by the premise and wonder how this new incarnation of the innocent, good Myshkin fares.

Below is a link to a review of this movie.

After the movie I'll be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row. We can then walk down Huntington Ave. to a Middle Eastern Cafe across from Northeastern or any of the other local eateries.

Admission $9



For more information, see http://www.timeout.co...
item.name: Return of the Idiot
